Herpes
Genital herpes infection can 
be caught through genital 
contact with an infected 
person or from oral sex 
with someone who has oral 
herpes (cold sores) and can 
be dangerous for a newborn 
baby. Initial infection causes 
very painful blisters or ulcers 
on the genitals. Less severe 
attacks usually occur for
